title: The 9 Best Le Labo Perfumes That Are Worth Every Penny
excerpt: Le Labo is one of the most popular and unique luxury fragrance brands. Here, editors tested the entire collection and found the nine best Le Labo scents.
text: Best Subtle Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Thé Matcha 26 Eau de ParfumConsMay smell strong initiallyIf you love sipping your morning matcha latte, why not opt to have it in spray form, too? This calming perfume contains sweet fig, contrasted with smooth bergamot and deep vetiver.Notes: Fig, bergamot, bitter orange, sesame, cedarwood, vetiver, matcha teaNordstrom rating: 4.7/5 starsA Nordstrom reviewer says: “It’s a creamy, tiny bit citrusy, very light scent to be noticed by someone intimately. My husband loves this scent, said it was pleasant and calm so I am buying a full bottle. Don’t expect it to be something for people around you to notice. It’s perfect for a relaxing day, cuddle and hug your loved one. Also suitable for work because it lingers long yet only for you to enjoy it.”Best Citrus Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Bergamote 22 Eau de ParfumConsCan feel masculine to someIf you know that bergamot is one of your go-to scent notes, it makes sense to opt for this fragrance. It’s rich and citrusy, with hints of musk and cedar to keep it grounded.Notes: Orange blossom, grapefruit, petitgrain, amber, bergamot, vetiver, cedar, muskNordstrom rating: 4.6/5 starsA Nordstrom reviewer says: “I ordered this without first smelling it–a risk. This is now one of my all time favorite fragrances. It is seductive while at the same time very clean smelling. I have not loved a scent this much in YEARS. Quality product. I also have the body lotion to layer the scent.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Sensual Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Tonka 25 Eau de ParfumConsCan smell intense for someFor a light, sensual fragrance, opt for Tonka 25. It’s a spicier perfume that still manages to feel fresh and light. If it’s date night, a spritz of this will seal the deal. Notes: Orange, flower absolue, cedar atlas, styrax resin, tonka, muskNordstrom rating: 4.5/5 starsA Nordstrom reviewer says: “This is a great cologne. If you want a unique, yet subtly bold fragrance this is it. It seems like the fragrances are layered. At times it’s bold, then it mellows out. You don’t need much 2 or 3 sprays to last all day. The scent has a reprise that will hit you at 7 PM even though it may have been applied much earlier in the day. Worth every penny!”Best Smoky Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Thé Noir 29 Eau de ParfumConsMay need to reapply throughout the day“Thé Noir 29 is fresh, but with notes of musk and tea to give it depth," says West. With contrasting notes like bergamot and tobacco, it manages to keep the balance between masculine and feminine. An ELLE Editor says: “If you loved Santal 33 but found it to be too popular, consider this to be the runner-up. This is the Le Labo scent I consider to be the second-most recognizable. The fragrance is tea-inspired, but without a sense of primness, like taking a deep inhale in a canister of black tea. This is entirely my opinion, but it also smells a little like smoking luxury weed to me–a little earthy and sweet, too.” –Kathleen Hou, ELLE beauty directorNotes: Bergamot, bay leaves, black tea, fig, hay, tobacco, cedarwood, vetiver, muskNordstrom rating: 4.4/5 starsAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Floral Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Lys 41 Eau de ParfumProsConsMay need to reapply throughout the dayFloral fragrances are classic, and this scent is packed with a wide variety, giving the sense that you are an entire bouquet. “I am a firm believer that there is a floral fragrance for everyone. Lys 41 is mine because it feels feminine but is not overly sweet,” says West.Notes: Lily, jasmine, tuberose, absolute, ambrette, vanilla, muskNordstrom rating: 4.5/5 starsA Nordstrom reviewer says: “My youngest daughter bought this for me as a Christmas gift and ever since, I have been enchanted by the scent. It seems too, that wherever I go, someone is asking me what perfume I am wearing. Le Labo does a wonderful job crafting their perfumes!”Most Unique Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Another 13 Eau de Parfum ConsMay take time to get used toWhile the scent notes in Another 13 may sound familiar, the end result is something very unique. It’s a subtle, clean scent with hints of spice and woods. “Another 13 is spicy, but still extremely light with a bit of sweetness,” says West. Plus, it smells slightly different on everyone's skin.Notes: Ambrox, musk, amber, jasmine, moss, ambrette seedsNordstrom rating: 4.3/5 starsA Nordstrom reviewer says: “A subtle skin scent that is what I imagine a paper mill or printing press warehouse would smell like. Upon first spray, you can catch a hint of jasmine and pear, then it quickly settles into clean, crisp white woods, and an almost metallic sharpness. I suspect this smells a little different on everyone as it mixes with your own skin musk. It’s sillage is soft enough to not overwhelm–I almost forget I’m wearing it. However, it clearly lingers since I’ve received compliments and inquiries on what fragrance I’m wearing. If you’re used to wearing potent, heady, room-filling perfumes, this is definitely not for you. If you would enjoy an understated fragrance that inspires you to cozy up on a leather couch and read a weathered library book, Another 13 might be up your alley.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowMost Popular Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Santal 33 Eau de ParfumConsSome prefer less popular fragrancesWhether you’re a perfume aficionado or a newcomer to the scent world, odds are you’ve heard of Santal 33. It’s a sensual, creamy perfume with just the right hints of florals and woods to keep it balanced.Notes: Australian sandalwood, cedarwood, cardamom, iris, violet, smoky wood alloy, ambrox, leather accord, muskNordstrom rating: 4.3/5 starsAn ELLE Editor says: “For a period of time in the 2000s, every luxury hotel in NYC and anyone who lived in SoHo smelled like this scent. The original inspiration was this fragrance was allegedly the American West, and once you smell its mix of smokey, woodsy, sexy notes, you never forget it. Particularly because someone you probably know is still wearing it. Whether it’s cult or classic, is up to you.” –Kathleen HouNewest Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Lavande 31 Eau de ParfumConsSome expect more lavenderLe Labo’s newest addition to their perfume collection is this springtime must-have. With head notes of lavender, mellowed by musk and tonka, the end result is an impeccably fresh scent.Notes: Lavender, bergamot, neroli, amber, musk, tonkaNordstrom rating: 3.7/5 starsAn ELLE Editor say: “This is my new favorite Le Labo scent–every time I smell it on someone (the last person was Women’s Health Beauty Director, Brian Underwood), I instantly ask, ‘You smell so good, what is that?’ Don’t come to this expecting any sort of spa or massage connotation from the lavender. To me, this smells like the fresh, clean notes of your favorite men’s perfume, combined with that dirty, sexy edge that Le Labo is so known for.” –Kathleen HouAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowBest Spicy Rose Le Labo PerfumeLe Labo Rose 31 Eau de ParfumConsMay need to reapply throughout the dayWhile the idea of a rose perfume might sound outdated or excessively feminine, Le Labo managed to create one that’s juxtaposed with woods and spice, completely changing the narrative.Notes: Rose, cumin, vetiver, musks, cedar, agarwood, olibanium, amber, guaiacwood, cistusNordstrom rating: 4.2/5 starsA Nordstrom reviewer says: “Don’t let the cumin burst at first spray scare you! It turned me off of this for years and I recently gave it another go round and this is the most gorgeous woody, soft rose. Not stuffy but very intriguing. I love it.”Meet the ExpertAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhy are people obsessed with Le Labo perfumes?While there are so many beloved perfume brands today, Le Labo stands out as a go-to not just for fragrance lovers, but for the everyday consumer. “Even with its growing popularity, Le Labo still feels niche and unique. It is a brand founded in the US and has a limited distribution, which I believe adds to the appeal of discovery,” says West. That, combined with their unique collection of scents, can begin to explain why the brand has retained its iconic fixture in the scent scene. “Le Labo stands out as a brand for a few reasons–their story, the unique-to-you customizable packaging, and their simple approach to creating fresh, finely blended fragrances,” West adds.How should people shop Le Labo perfumes?If you haven’t had the chance to try a Le Labo scent for yourself and are having trouble with the decision, in-store shopping allows you to test them all out. “It is important to keep an open mind when approaching any brand, but specifically with Le Labo. It is a journey to discover what notes you like and work for you with an expert behind the counter guiding you through different scents to inspire you. I always recommend trying fragrance with a sample first to see if you like the wear and notes as they interact with your natural body scent. Nordstrom will always have samples ready and waiting for you!” says West.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWhy trust ELLE Beauty?As a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, Tatjana Freund tested a few top-rated Le Labo perfumes and pored over reviews for dozens of others, evaluating each on their features and customer feedback.
html:
Best Subtle Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Thé Matcha 26 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • May smell strong initially

If you love sipping your morning matcha latte, why not opt to have it in spray form, too? This calming perfume contains sweet fig, contrasted with smooth bergamot and deep vetiver.

Notes: Fig, bergamot, bitter orange, sesame, cedarwood, vetiver, matcha tea

Nordstrom rating: 4.7/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “It’s a creamy, tiny bit citrusy, very light scent to be noticed by someone intimately. My husband loves this scent, said it was pleasant and calm so I am buying a full bottle. Don’t expect it to be something for people around you to notice. It’s perfect for a relaxing day, cuddle and hug your loved one. Also suitable for work because it lingers long yet only for you to enjoy it.”

Best Citrus Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Bergamote 22 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • Can feel masculine to some

If you know that bergamot is one of your go-to scent notes, it makes sense to opt for this fragrance. It’s rich and citrusy, with hints of musk and cedar to keep it grounded.

Notes: Orange blossom, grapefruit, petitgrain, amber, bergamot, vetiver, cedar, musk

Nordstrom rating: 4.6/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “I ordered this without first smelling it–a risk. This is now one of my all time favorite fragrances. It is seductive while at the same time very clean smelling. I have not loved a scent this much in YEARS. Quality product. I also have the body lotion to layer the scent.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Sensual Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Tonka 25 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • Can smell intense for some

For a light, sensual fragrance, opt for Tonka 25. It’s a spicier perfume that still manages to feel fresh and light. If it’s date night, a spritz of this will seal the deal.

Notes: Orange, flower absolue, cedar atlas, styrax resin, tonka, musk

Nordstrom rating: 4.5/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “This is a great cologne. If you want a unique, yet subtly bold fragrance this is it. It seems like the fragrances are layered. At times it’s bold, then it mellows out. You don’t need much 2 or 3 sprays to last all day. The scent has a reprise that will hit you at 7 PM even though it may have been applied much earlier in the day. Worth every penny!”

Best Smoky Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Thé Noir 29 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • May need to reapply throughout the day

“Thé Noir 29 is fresh, but with notes of musk and tea to give it depth," says West. With contrasting notes like bergamot and tobacco, it manages to keep the balance between masculine and feminine.

An ELLE Editor says: “If you loved Santal 33 but found it to be too popular, consider this to be the runner-up. This is the Le Labo scent I consider to be the second-most recognizable. The fragrance is tea-inspired, but without a sense of primness, like taking a deep inhale in a canister of black tea. This is entirely my opinion, but it also smells a little like smoking luxury weed to me–a little earthy and sweet, too.” –Kathleen Hou, ELLE beauty director

Notes: Bergamot, bay leaves, black tea, fig, hay, tobacco, cedarwood, vetiver, musk

Nordstrom rating: 4.4/5 stars

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Floral Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Lys 41 Eau de Parfum

Pros

Cons

  • May need to reapply throughout the day

Floral fragrances are classic, and this scent is packed with a wide variety, giving the sense that you are an entire bouquet. “I am a firm believer that there is a floral fragrance for everyone. Lys 41 is mine because it feels feminine but is not overly sweet,” says West.

Notes: Lily, jasmine, tuberose, absolute, ambrette, vanilla, musk

Nordstrom rating: 4.5/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “My youngest daughter bought this for me as a Christmas gift and ever since, I have been enchanted by the scent. It seems too, that wherever I go, someone is asking me what perfume I am wearing. Le Labo does a wonderful job crafting their perfumes!”

Most Unique Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Another 13 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • May take time to get used to

While the scent notes in Another 13 may sound familiar, the end result is something very unique. It’s a subtle, clean scent with hints of spice and woods. “Another 13 is spicy, but still extremely light with a bit of sweetness,” says West. Plus, it smells slightly different on everyone's skin.

Notes: Ambrox, musk, amber, jasmine, moss, ambrette seeds

Nordstrom rating: 4.3/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “A subtle skin scent that is what I imagine a paper mill or printing press warehouse would smell like. Upon first spray, you can catch a hint of jasmine and pear, then it quickly settles into clean, crisp white woods, and an almost metallic sharpness. I suspect this smells a little different on everyone as it mixes with your own skin musk. It’s sillage is soft enough to not overwhelm–I almost forget I’m wearing it. However, it clearly lingers since I’ve received compliments and inquiries on what fragrance I’m wearing. If you’re used to wearing potent, heady, room-filling perfumes, this is definitely not for you. If you would enjoy an understated fragrance that inspires you to cozy up on a leather couch and read a weathered library book, Another 13 might be up your alley.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Most Popular Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Santal 33 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • Some prefer less popular fragrances

Whether you’re a perfume aficionado or a newcomer to the scent world, odds are you’ve heard of Santal 33. It’s a sensual, creamy perfume with just the right hints of florals and woods to keep it balanced.

Notes: Australian sandalwood, cedarwood, cardamom, iris, violet, smoky wood alloy, ambrox, leather accord, musk

Nordstrom rating: 4.3/5 stars

An ELLE Editor says: “For a period of time in the 2000s, every luxury hotel in NYC and anyone who lived in SoHo smelled like this scent. The original inspiration was this fragrance was allegedly the American West, and once you smell its mix of smokey, woodsy, sexy notes, you never forget it. Particularly because someone you probably know is still wearing it. Whether it’s cult or classic, is up to you.” –Kathleen Hou

Newest Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Lavande 31 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • Some expect more lavender

Le Labo’s newest addition to their perfume collection is this springtime must-have. With head notes of lavender, mellowed by musk and tonka, the end result is an impeccably fresh scent.

Notes: Lavender, bergamot, neroli, amber, musk, tonka

Nordstrom rating: 3.7/5 stars

An ELLE Editor say: “This is my new favorite Le Labo scent–every time I smell it on someone (the last person was Women’s Health Beauty Director, Brian Underwood), I instantly ask, ‘You smell so good, what is that?’ Don’t come to this expecting any sort of spa or massage connotation from the lavender. To me, this smells like the fresh, clean notes of your favorite men’s perfume, combined with that dirty, sexy edge that Le Labo is so known for.” –Kathleen Hou

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best Spicy Rose Le Labo Perfume

Le Labo Rose 31 Eau de Parfum

Cons

  • May need to reapply throughout the day

While the idea of a rose perfume might sound outdated or excessively feminine, Le Labo managed to create one that’s juxtaposed with woods and spice, completely changing the narrative.

Notes: Rose, cumin, vetiver, musks, cedar, agarwood, olibanium, amber, guaiacwood, cistus

Nordstrom rating: 4.2/5 stars

A Nordstrom reviewer says: “Don’t let the cumin burst at first spray scare you! It turned me off of this for years and I recently gave it another go round and this is the most gorgeous woody, soft rose. Not stuffy but very intriguing. I love it.”

Meet the Expert

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Why are people obsessed with Le Labo perfumes?

While there are so many beloved perfume brands today, Le Labo stands out as a go-to not just for fragrance lovers, but for the everyday consumer. “Even with its growing popularity, Le Labo still feels niche and unique. It is a brand founded in the US and has a limited distribution, which I believe adds to the appeal of discovery,” says West. That, combined with their unique collection of scents, can begin to explain why the brand has retained its iconic fixture in the scent scene. “Le Labo stands out as a brand for a few reasons–their story, the unique-to-you customizable packaging, and their simple approach to creating fresh, finely blended fragrances,” West adds.

How should people shop Le Labo perfumes?

If you haven’t had the chance to try a Le Labo scent for yourself and are having trouble with the decision, in-store shopping allows you to test them all out. “It is important to keep an open mind when approaching any brand, but specifically with Le Labo. It is a journey to discover what notes you like and work for you with an expert behind the counter guiding you through different scents to inspire you. I always recommend trying fragrance with a sample first to see if you like the wear and notes as they interact with your natural body scent. Nordstrom will always have samples ready and waiting for you!” says West.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Why trust ELLE Beauty?

As a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. For this piece, Tatjana Freund tested a few top-rated Le Labo perfumes and pored over reviews for dozens of others, evaluating each on their features and customer feedback.
